ygData.subject: Re: BlackFortress
ygData.msgSnippet: Tucson calmly turns his head in the direction of the sound of Rodimus s voice.  He also had a question for Rodimus and this time narrows a coy brow. And why

Tucson calmly turns his head in the direction of the sound of Rodimus's voi=
ce.  He also had a question for Rodimus and this time narrows a coy brow.

=
"And why do you keep working for Hydras?  The lowest slag on this planet, a=
nd you still work for him as if he's some sort of deity.  At least I know w=
ho I serve and the one I serve is faithful.  More than I can say for your s=
o called leader who is just leading you by the front axle.  Oh yes, lowest =
of the low, and he's probably gloating over the fact that he's successfully=
 captured two Autobot Leaders.  I could sense that in his voice Rodimus, I'=
m far from being a mindless piece of scrap.  So you keep asking me why I ha=
ven't given up, I'll keep asking you why you work for Hydras.  And I will N=
OT give you an answer until you tell me yours.  Final, end of discussion."
=

He gives his last statement with a very cold tone to his voice.  Something=
 Optimus Prime would have done if facing Megatron.  Then he remembers one m=
ore and with the same cold narrowing of a brow, he directs his head back to=
ward the direction of the sound.

" Because a quitter like you, isn't worth=
 telling the truth to.  That's what you are Rodimus, a quitter.  I'm not sa=
ying it to be cold, I'm telling it as it is.  Do you want to be known as a =
turn tail?  If so, tell me.  But if you had any back frame what so ever, yo=
u would get over your little bout of self pitty and you'd get off your aft =
and do something to turn your life around.  I'm not falling for it Rodimus,=
 I am NOT falling through the cracks like you have.  If you want my help, I=
'll be glad to give it to you, but YOU HAVE TO SHOW ME YOU HAVE THE COURAGE=
 TO GET OVER THIS, IF YOU DON'T THEN I CAN NOT HELP YOU! THE MATRIX CAN NOT=
 HELP YOU!  PRIMUS WILL NOT BE ABLE TO HELP YOU!  AND MOST CERTAINLY, HYDRA=
S DOESN'T GIVE A SCRAP ABOUT YOU, SO HE'S PRETTY CONTENT IN KEEPING YOU AS =
HIS LITTLE PUPPET!"

He hoped that by telling Rodimus as it was, he could s=
nap him into realizing what damage he's doing to himself.  Tucson Prime was=
 very good at it, although his temper was something that he needed to work =
on.  He then turns his head away from the source of the sound.

" That's it=
, I'm tired of talking to you.  I've told you as it is, you dont' like it, =
that's tough scrap."

In Night Shift's cell, he senses the all clear, and g=
oes back to using ninjabot excercises with his hands, to try and make his w=
rists a bit more limber in the restraints.  With a tiny pop, he's able to d=
isjoint his own left wrist to the point where it appears much more flexible=
 than his right.  He maneuvers his fingers and his palm and compresses them=
 to the point where he can actually squeeze the hand through the restraint =
to the point where he his hand slips out, without a sound.  He experiments =
and does the same thing to put it back in.  

"I knew I'd get it sooner or =
later.  Too bad I can't transmit ta Kup. I wonder if he knows this trick...=
"

He pops his wrist back into joint and keeps his hand inside the restrain=
t.  He winces, seeing that the process did cause a slight bit of discomfort=
.

"Ow."

Outside, Quickstride and Rat Trap were getting tired of being und=
erestimated and Rat Trap jumps off, dumping the junk as Quickstride maximiz=
es into his robot form, with his large blast cannon over his shoulder.

" A=
hh what the heck?  Shooting is much more fun anyway."

Rat Trap nodds, and =
takes out his own revolver.

"Yeah, easier on the aft too."  

Quickstride =
narrows his eyes at Scourge he meant business.

" Time ta shoot the birdie!=
 C'mon, make a shot, make a shot I dare ya!" 

--- In nbwrpg@...=
m, Preston Carroll <supercyclonus@...> wrote:
>
> Who: RODIMUS
> Location: =
Black Fortress - Prison cell control room
> 
> > Tucson Prime knew he had h=
is work cut out for him. It wouldn't be easy attempting to turn Rodimus aro=
und. He simply sighs, and does not give anyone the satisfaction of losing h=
is temper. The less he expressed his disdain, the more he hoped to cause a =
bit of frustration among his captives. He had an old saying. "Don't get mad=
, use your strongest of attributes and talents to passively retaliate again=
st your enemies.
> >
> > "Ohh well, I may be in trouble for a while, and it=
 wouldn't be the first time."
> 
> Rodimus stepped into the control room as=
 Tuscon was making his
> comment. While the others in the cells could not h=
ear each other,
> Rodimus could each one of them if he chose to.
> 
> He gl=
anced at the security screen to watch Tuscon, laying there
> practically im=
mobile by the restraints, and yet he was still trying to
> speak. Part of R=
odimus was disdainful of the Autobot, but then again
> there was something =
about his courage and conviction that touched him
> strangely.
> 
> Fightin=
g that emotion Rodimus jabbed on the control stud that would
> send his voi=
ce down to Tuscon, into the speaker by his ear. "What have
> you to say for=
 yourself now Autobot?" Rodimus said as he watched him.
> "You have lost, w=
hy don't you just give up?"
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
